org.openimaj.ml.clustering

Interface SpatialClusters<DATATYPE>

  • Type Parameters:
    DATATYPE - the primitive array datatype which represents a centroid of this cluster.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Clusters, Readable, ReadableASCII, ReadableBinary, ReadWriteable, Writeable, WriteableASCII, WriteableBinary
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ByteCentroidsResult, ClusterLimitedIntRAC, DoubleCentroidsResult, DoubleDBSCANClusters, FeatureVectorCentroidsResult, FloatCentroidsResult, HierarchicalByteKMeansResult, HierarchicalDoubleKMeansResult, HierarchicalFloatKMeansResult, HierarchicalIntKMeansResult, HierarchicalLongKMeansResult, HierarchicalShortKMeansResult, IntCentroidsResult, IntRAC, IntRandomForest, KDTreeClusters, LongCentroidsResult, ShortCentroidsResult, SphericalKMeansResult

    public interface SpatialClusters<DATATYPE>
extends Clusters
    Interface to describe objects that are the result of the clustering performed by a SpatialClusterer.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

      • defaultHardAssigner

        HardAssigner<DATATYPE,?,?> defaultHardAssigner()
        Get the default hard assigner for this clusterer. This method is potentially expensive, so callers should only call it once, and hold on to the result (and reuse it).
        Returns:
        a hard assigner.
